alert.note: Alert for Allegheny; Westmoreland (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 05 at 3:05PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Allegheny and Westmoreland. * WHEN...Until 415 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 305 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain fell earlier this afternoon due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pittsburgh, Monroeville, McKeesport, Plum, West Mifflin, Baldwin, Murrysville, Whitehall, Munhall, Jefferson Hills, North Versailles, Brentwood, Swissvale, Pleasant Hills, White Oak, Clairton, Forest Hills, Wilkins Township, Duquesne and Turtle Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
